Speaker: Boy
Text: I found some.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Get in the boat, boy.
[He puts a cut down birch on his shoulder and goes to the boat.]

Speaker: Boy
Text: Still want me to tie it to the boat?
[Kratos throws a birch into the water without words, attaches it with a hook, and the other end throws it to the boy. The boy ties the rope to the boat.]

Speaker: Kratos
Text: That is enough.
[They board the boat and sail away. The Journey begins.]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Father?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: What?

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Did something change? The forest feels different now.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Everything is different, boy. Try not to dwell on it.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Yes, sir.
[They go to their home. Kratos puts the log to the others.]

Speaker: Kratos
Text: That was the last.
[Atreus enters the house to pray over the dead.]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Lo, there do I see my Mother. Lo, is there do I see my Father. Lo, there do they call to me. Lo, there do they call to me. Lo, there do they call to me. She’s ready.
[Kratos enter the house. He stands at the doorstep, his face covered with darkness. He takes the body in his arms and carries him to the stacked chopped firewood.]

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Find your way home. You are free.

[He sets the firewood on fire striking the spark with his axe. The body begins to burn. A minute later, Atreus realizes that he forgot to pick up the knife. He runs up to the burning body and grabs the knife with his hands, but it proves to be too hot and Arteus burns his hand and drop the knife.]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: I’m sorry.
[Kratos comes up to him, picks up some snow with his hands and applies it to Atreus’ burned hand.]

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Squeeze. This knife… It was hers. Now it is yours. She taught you to hunt?

Speaker: Atreus
Text: What she knew.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Show me.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Now?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Now.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: What’re we hunting?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: You are hunting deer.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Which way?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: In the direction of deer.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Okay…? Uhh… this way-
[They go hunting. A lot of snow around. Wild, unspoiled nature.]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Father… why are we doing this now?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: I need to know you can survive the journey.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Then we leave for the mountain?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Depends on you. Hunt.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: What did you find?

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Tracks. Not deer though. I keep looking.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Boy. You miss these.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Huh… Close, but also not deer. See? Tips are too wide. Mountain goat?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: You mother taught you well.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Yeah… I’ll see what’s up ahead.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: More tracks?

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Yeah. But they’re too round. Could be a wild boar.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Good.
[Atreus sees fallen bridge.]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Oop. Now what?
[Kratos easily jump over the fall bridge.]

Speaker: Kratos
Text: This way, boy.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Hup! Oh. Wait. Deer tracks. They’re fresh. This way.
[He runs forward and unexpectedly stumbles upon a huge deer.]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Aaah! Found it.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Slow down, boy!

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Sorry…

Speaker: Kratos
Text: You are hunting dear - not chasing it.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Yes, father.
[A huge deer with big winding horns appears in their way. Frightened of uninvited guests, he runs away, destroying the small bridge with his massive hooves.]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: He broke our bridge… how are we gonna get across?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Step aside.
[Kratos takes his axe, Leviathan, in his mighty hands and throws it to the barrier. When it breaks the axe returns to Kratos’s hand.]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Wow.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Go.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Woah. What happened here? There it is!

Speaker: Kratos
Text: HOLD.
[Despite the outcry of his father Atreus shoots and misses.]

Speaker: Kratos
Text: What are you doing? Now its guard is up! Only fire…  Only fire when I tell you to fire.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: I’m sorry…

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Do not be sorry. Be better. Find it. (Atreus tries to take back his bow, but Kratos doesn’t let him) Find. It.
[They stumbles upon zombie-like creature.]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Ahh! My bow!

Speaker: Kratos
Text: No! You are not ready - stay back!

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Father! Above you! Watch your right!
[Kratos destroys the dead using the inhuman strength of his fists and his magical axe that freezes enemies.]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Draugr? They’ve never come this close to our woods before.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Keep moving.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Uh… deer’s this way. I can see more tracks… or we can follow you.
[They descend into a small cave by a chain attached to a stone.]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Wolves!
[Kratos smashes them to death with bare hands.]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: They were just hungry.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: What?

Speaker: Atreus
Text: The wolves. They weren’t mean. They were starving.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Yes. I imagine they were.
[He opens a nearby tomb and takes a few coins from there.]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: What - ?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: He can no longer use it. We can.
[They continue the journey.]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Are we lost? Nah… Should we be in here?
[Atreus notes that the deer jumped over the dilapidated wall of the old temple…]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Up there! He went in the old temple. But Mom told me never to go in there.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: We do what we please, boy. No excuses.
[He opens a massive wooden door.]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Look.
[He notices the deer. It stands at a fairly small distance from the characters, but it is impossible to get closer.]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Can I have my bow back now?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Can you hit it from here?

Speaker: Atreus
Text: We should get closer.
[They go around, trying to get closer to the deer.]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: I went hunting with mother a bunch of times. You never wanted to take me. Why now?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: It was her wish. And… it was time.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Ok. Draugr!
[Kratos breaks through their skulls.]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Something’s gotta open that gate… It’s opening. You froze it in place. Clever.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Follow me, Atreus.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Sooo… Nice. Where you going? I think he’s this way.
[In the far corner of a small cave, Atreus notices a skillfully made plaque on which a story from northern legends is drawn. The plaque is closed with two shutters.]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Oh look, it’s Skoll & Hati – the giant wolves who chase the sun and moon. Where did they come from? How did they get up there? What’s happening there at the end? They eat the sun and moon and then everybody fights?
[After a short wander, Kratos and Atreus find the deer again. Atreus is preparing to shoot an innocent creature for the first time.]

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Wait for my mark… Relax. Do not think of it as an animal. It is simply a target. Clear your mind.  Steady your aim and breathe in. Exhale and release.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: I got it.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Good.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: It’s… it’s still alive.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Your knife… No. Finish what you started.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: I can’t…
[Kratos clutching his hand with a knife in his hand. Together they finish the animal.]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: I…
[Suddenly a giant troll attacks them. There’s a piece of stone column in his hands, and fire and rage in his eyes.]

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Atreus!

Speaker: Atreus
Text: We’re going to fight that?!?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: We have no choice.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Miss! Okay - just tell as when to shoot! WHOA! Watch your right! Sorry can’t. Nista! Watch ’em! Tell me when… He’s too strong! We keep hitting him! Why isn’t he falling?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Get back, boy.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Fall, dammit! FALL! Ready and waning. Watch out Father! Sorry, not ready. Ready.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Get control of yourself, boy!

Speaker: Atreus
Text: I’m FINE. Kill it!
[Kratos kills the troll by ripping his skull apart. Atrey runs up to the corpse and begins to stab him furiously and scream.]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: RAAAA! That’s what you get.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Boy.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Think I’m afraid of you?! You’re nothing to me!

Speaker: Kratos
Text: BOY!

Speaker: Atreus
Text: NOTHING!

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Look at me! Look at me, boy!

Speaker: Atreus
Text: NOTHING!

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Boy – look at me!

Speaker: Atreus
Text: We DID it.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: You are not ready.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: What? Are you serious? I found the deer. I proved myself. How am not ready?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: We are going home.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: I haven’t been sick in a long time. I can do this.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: You are NOT ready.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: I AM ready.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Do not speak again.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: The path home is this way. Duh.
[Kratos is about to return home.]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Still can’t get the doors open, huh?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Quiet.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: What is THAT thing? I told you something was different about the forest.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: And I told you do not to speak.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: But why would a Fire Troll burn mother’s garden? And since when are Draugr so close to the house? And what was that frozen thing that attacked us?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: I do not know. Now be silent, we are almost home. Inside, boy.
[Soon they're going back to their cabin.]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: It’s not fair. He doesn’t know anything…

Speaker: Kratos
Text: You lost control.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: That thing was trying to kill us. It’s not like you don’t get angry in a fight.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Anger can be a weapon if you control it – use it. You clearly cannot. When you lose…

Speaker: Atreus
Text: I haven’t been sick in a long time. I’m better now.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Fine.  Come on then.
Action: (puts his hands in front of him)

Speaker: Atreus
Text: You want me to hit you?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: I want you to try.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: OWWW! What are you - ?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Try again.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Why are you doing that?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Too slow. Try again.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Cut it out!

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Weak. Again. Again.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: STOP IT!

Speaker: Kratos
Text: AGAIN.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: (slight cough]

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Your anger… you can get lost in it. The path ahead is difficult and you, Atreus, are clearly not ready.
[Someone's knocking on their door.]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: What was that?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: QUIET.
[There's a slightly cocky, confident voice coming from behind the door.]

Speaker: The Stranger
Text: Come on out! It’s no use hiding anymore. I know who you are...

Speaker: Atreus
Text: What’s going on? Do you know him?

Speaker: The Stranger
Text: ...more importantly I know what you are!

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Boy. Beneath the ﬂoor. Now…

Speaker: Atreus
Text: But… you told me never to go down there. Who is that?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: I do not know.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: What’s he talking about?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: I do not know. Get IN.

Speaker: The Stranger
Text: Just tell me what I want to know! No need for this to get bloody.
[Kratos comes out of the cabin. He is met by a lean man with a light-brown beard. The man wears almost no clothes - only light pants. His body is covered in blue tattoos.]

Speaker: The Stranger
Text: Thought you’d be bigger. But you’re definitely the one. Long way from home, aren’t you?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: What do you want?

Speaker: The Stranger
Text: Oh, you already know the answer to that.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Whatever it is you seek I do not have it. You should move on.

Speaker: The Stranger
Text: Hahaha. And here I thought your kind was supposed to be so enlightened. So much better than us. So much smarter. And yet you hide out here in the woods - like a coward.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: You do not want this fight.

Speaker: The Stranger
Text: Oh… I’m pretty sure I do. (hits Kratos]

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Leave… my… home.

Speaker: The Stranger
Text: You are going to have to kill me for that to happen. (hits Kratos again]

Speaker: Kratos
Text: I warned you -

Speaker: The Stranger
Text: Finally.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: You would not listen.

Speaker: The Stranger
Text: No… No, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no. Fine. My turn.

Speaker: The Stranger
Text: How incredibly disappointing. Come on then. Pointless. You bore me. Are you even trying? Come on, already. So slow… Tell me what I want… Pain stops. Real simple. Why are there two beds in there?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: LEAVE! MY! HOME!

Speaker: The Stranger
Text: Struck a nerve, did I?! Who are you hiding?! Slow and old. You should never have come to Midgard. So… care to try again?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: You talk too much.

Speaker: The Stranger
Text: You won’t talk? Fine. Maybe whoever it is you’ve got stashed in that house will.

Speaker: The Stranger
Text: Who is it? Who are you afraid I’ll find?! Let’s find out! Pointless! What are you hiding? You still bore me. You’re a fool.

Speaker: The Stranger
Text: Leaving so soon? When Odin sent me here, I just needed answers, but YOU, you had to act all proud. Throw whatever you have at me… I’ll keep coming. That old body will give our. But before I end this, I want you to know one thing… I can’t feel any of this.

Speaker: The Stranger
Text: You’ve seen it with your own eyes; you can’t hurt me. Nothing can. This fight is pointless. Your struggle ls pointless. It didn’t have to be this way. Pathetic. You can’t win. I feel nothing, but you… you feel everything. Yet you, you keep trying. I’m not my brother. And if you’d given me what I wanted, it wouldn’t have ended this way. But no… Let’s finish this.

Speaker: The Stranger
Text: Can’t beat me! COME ON! I feel NOTHING! NOTHING! WORTHLESS! PITIFUL! I will end you!

Speaker: The Stranger
Text: I’d hoped that you, of everyone I’d faced, would finally make me feel something. But you can’t.
[Kratos snaps his neck and throws the body into the crevesse, after which it hardly rises and goes to the house.]

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Who was he? He knew me. Did he know my past? How did they find me… after all this time? Faye… what do I do? Our son is not ready… to carry your ashes… to the top of the mountain. And neither am I. I do not know… how to do this without you. But we cannot stay here…
[He enters half destroyed house.]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: There was so much… I thought… You’re all right.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: I am all right. Come. Gather your things. We are leaving.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Thought I wasn’t ready.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: You are not. But we have no choice now. Prove me wrong.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Yes, sir.
[They leave the house.]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: The mountain… it’s gonna be a LONG trip.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Yes. But an important one.
[“THE MARKED TREES” COMPLETED.]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Whoa… how did this happen? Who was he?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: I do not know.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: What did he want with us? We’re nobodies. Did you kill him?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: I did what had to be done.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: You could have died. Never have me alone again. All right?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: All right. Up.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: You’ve had to kill people before, haven’t you? You’re used to it.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: We do what we must to survive.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Animals, I get. They’re food. Draugr… they’re supposed to be dead. But people… they’re trying to survive too.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Close your heart to it. On our journey, we will be attacked by all manner of creature. Close your heart to their desperation. Close your heart to their suffering. Do not allow yourself to feel for them. They will not feel for you.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: I understand.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Has this been here all this time? Why don’t you help me up there? I can get a better look. Hop!
[Kratos boosts Atreus up.]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Okay… nowhere to go from here… except across this bridge. Think you can lower it from there?
[Kratos lower the bridge.]

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Go.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Made it!

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Boy…

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Yes, sir.
[Kratos freezes the cog of the bridge and climbs up.]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Good idea… This way. I think. Father… will we see others on the road?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Yes.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Friendly?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: No.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: They’ll try and rob us?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Possibly. Yes.
[They climb to the top. Atreus notices stunning view of wild and unspoiled nature…]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Look… All this time… there’s been a protection stave around our entire woods. But… the stave’s broken there. Did you cut those down?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: She hand-marked the trees she wished used for her pyre…

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Why’d she do that?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Come. No looking back now.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: So… how long will it take to get to the mountain?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: I do not know.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Before winter falls?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: I do not know…

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Okay, okay…
[They reaches Wildwood’s Edge and find some draugr in a small field.]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: They don’t see us. ShouId I fire?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Wait for my mark.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: More draugr! Draugr down! Watch out, Father! One less draugr to worry about! Right flank! More draugr! Whoah, this one throws fire! How does he do that?!

Speaker: Kratos
Text: BOY! Focus. Look alive, boy!

Speaker: Atreus
Text: I see them! Fire, incoming!

Speaker: Kratos
Text: More enemies, boy!

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Yes, sir! Father! When is this gonna end! Another one down! Amazing! Keep the pressure on. Careful! Look out!
[After defeating all draugr…]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: How was that? Did I help?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: If you want to help, distract them. Whoever is not my focus should be yours… but only when safe to do so.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: I can do that.
[Kratos find a stone nearby with writings on it.]

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Boy.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Sir. There’s a Jotnar settlement ahead…

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Jotnar?

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Giants.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: You can read the writing?

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Some -- just the languages mother knew. But they’re all sort of connected so sometimes I can feel my way through stuff I shouldn’t know. Y’know?
[They climb up the mountain. Atreus stumble upon some agile draugr.]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: AAH! I’m set! Anything else?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Space your shots. Speed costs accuracy.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Got it. Hey… I think there’s a chest over there!
[Kratos opens a chest and finds his first rune. He trying to use it right away.]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Whoa! How’d you do that?! I think we can go through here.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Move.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Thanks. There’s the mountain! Let’s go! (runs away]

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Not yet!
[Atreus runs to a bridge to the mountain.]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: It’s fine!
[He jumps on the bridge and one of the planks cracks]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Aaah! Father, help!

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Hang on!

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Hurry! I’m slipping!

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Hang on! Stay calm.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Aaah!
[They both falls.]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Huh… that wasn’t so bad.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: SLOW DOWN. Your haste will cost us.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Sorry…
[Around our heroes are a lot of draugrs standing still…]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Uh… more Draugr. But these aren’t moving. Are they dead? I mean… more dead?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Boooy…

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Not dead! Not dead!

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Remember: Accuracy over speed!

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Look out Father! That Draugr’s injured, get him! On your right, incoming fire! Yeah, take that! You don’t look so great! Fire, above us! One more to go! That was the last one. Was I better?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Take even more time. It does not matter if you fire only once. Show me control.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Look at this…

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Read it.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Oh. This used to be a marketplace. The Giants used to gather here to trade with the gods a long time ago. Wonder if Odin was ever here… Look — above us! Something’s breaking through! Something’s breaking through the wall! Draugr! I can’t get free! I need help! Father, I need you! He’s got me, help! Tell me when… Nista! Watch out! Look out Father! Need more time. Ready and waiting. Sorry, not ready. I’m exhausted. Look — there’s an opening up there.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Uh… do you hear that? What is it?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: We will see. Stay close.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: What is that? So we’re going towards the scary singing? It’s a Revenant!! Watch ’em! Poison! I’m ready. She just disappeared?! Nista! Poison, incoming! She’s too fast for your axe!

Speaker: Kratos
Text: But not for your arrows! Fire!

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Nista! Watch out Father! That was a real Revenant! Never thought I’d see one up close… I still don’t understand why that man attacked you at our house.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: I told you, boy, I know nothing more of it.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Look up there! I guess we need to get back up there. But how?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Follow me.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Boy.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: I’ve seen this language before…

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Here, boy other one.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: It says his name is “Hrungnir”. Mother told me about him… a Giant warrior, made of stone. Looks like he was in a pretty big battle… Odin’s there… Thor… even the World Serpent? Aw, Thor must have smashed his head apart, see? But look. Hrungnir’s body squished him. Idiot…

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Earlier… you said people might try and rob us. I’ll kill them if they try. I’m not afraid.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: If we encounter men, you will stay out of it, understand?

Speaker: Atreus
Text: But… I can fight now.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: You will stay out of it, boy. Speak no more of this. Atreus, follow me.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Sorry, I got distracted.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Grab that one, Father! You’re kinda scary sometimes!
[The fight was fierce but Kratos manages to overcome his enemies.]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Thought they almost had us.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: We must stay vigilant.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: You did it.
[They cross the bridge and find mountains of corpses on the other side.]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: All these dead… you think it’s safe in there?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: You think it safer out here?

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Echh… What’s that smell?
NOW!!
[The door behind the heroes slams shut. A group of men surrounds Kratos and Atreus.]

Speaker: Man 1
Text: Are they Hel-Walkers?

Speaker: Man 2
Text: They’re untouched! Look!

Speaker: Man 3
Text: Someone start the fires!

Speaker: Man 2
Text: Siegmund, your mas!

Speaker: Man 4
Text: So many days… Without meat.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Meat? Wait - us?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Behind me.

Speaker: Man 3
Text: What if they change like the others?

Speaker: Man 1
Text: We’ll have to keep them alive. Strip off their meat… a little at a time.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: This fight is mine alone.
[Kratos pulls out his axe. Being ordinary people, the enemies is no threat to him.]

Speaker: Man 1
Text: He wields magic!

Speaker: Man 2
Text: He’s just one man! Wait for an opening!
[Having hacked most of the cannibals, Kratos enthusiastically chokes one of them. At this time, Atreus is trying to fend off the last of the cannibals.]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Father! Help me!

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Atreus!
[Kratos runs up to him, but Atreus stabs the cannibal with his mother’s knife at the last moment.]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: (breathing efforts]

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Close your heart to it. Come then.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: We have a long journey ahead -
[The cannibals tuns into walkers.]

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Wait here. I will handle this.
[He crushes the walkers with his own hands.]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Th-They came back.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: It is finished.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: I want to leave here.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: We must find a way out. Find something to pull me up.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Okay.
[Atreus slowly go to the chain, immersed in sad thoughts.]

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Atreus… the chain.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: The chain, right.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: You are in your head, boy. Let it go. He would have killed you.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: I know. I had to do it. I do know that. I just…

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Then we will go home, boy.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: What?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: To give up this easily, so close to the start…
[Atrey instantly comes to his senses and runs to the chain.]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: I’m not giving up. I can do this. I just have to… you know… catch my breath. Come on up. I’m ready.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Listen to me… To be effective in combat, a warrior must not feel for his enemy. The road ahead is long and unforgiving… no place for a boy. You must be a warrior.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: I understand.
[They hear someone swearing from afar…]
Get up and move your ass! I’ll kick you square in the ringer you don’t move! C’moooooon! Whatcha waitin’ for? C’mon already! LET’S GO! Whatcha waitin’ for? C’mon already! Let’s go! Grrrrrahhhh!
[They find a dwarf trying to force his… uh, elephant… to cross the bridge.]

Speaker: Dwarf
Text: Can’t get this sloe-eyed cocklump to cross the bridge! Hrmph!

Speaker: Atreus
Text: It’s because she’s scared of something in the trees over there.

Speaker: Dwarf
Text: There’s what now?

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Father, throw your axe at those trees on the other side I the bridge - the ones with the white trunks.
[Kratos reluctantly fulfills the request.]

Speaker: Kratos
Text: You were right…

Speaker: Dwarf
Text: Hey… you must be smart or somethin’, boy. You are a boy aren’tcha?  HAAA!

Speaker: Atreus
Text: She have a name?

Speaker: Dwarf
Text: I dunno. Rude bastard ain’t ever asked mine so I ain’t ever asked hers. HAAA!!

Speaker: Atreus
Text: What’s yours?

Speaker: Dwarf
Text: Brok.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Vera logn…
[The elephant start to walk.]

Speaker: Brok
Text: Say… you’re not gonna believe me but uh… that axe you got, uh? It was me what made her - me and my brother. Was one of our best. So don’t let nobody else go work on her except for us two.  AAACH! You gotta handle her special or she’ll wreck beyond fixin’. I can enhance her for you right now if it so pleases you son of bitch. So what say you?  HAA!
Action: (to Kratos) (the elephant slaps him with her tail) (slaps the elephant)

Speaker: Kratos
Text: You are right… I do not believe you. Come, boy.

Speaker: Brok
Text: There’s a rune in the shape of a fork - under the grip.
[Kratos checks the axe.]

Speaker: Brok
Text: Aw… digr bikkja! Dumbr bak-rauf!  That was our brand my brother and me, before we split. I got half of it right here – see? Look, you want I should upgrade her or not?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Very well. I expect an improvement.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: So where’s the other half of the brand?

Speaker: Brok
Text: Oh, my dumb brother’s got it. But I got all the talent. Look! Let’s get to it! Try that on for size… What’s it gonna be? Make you something? See if that don’t shoot straighter than straight… Oh, you make up yer mind?
[He upgrades the axe and sells some equipment.]

Speaker: Brok
Text: Well, don’t look now but our friends who were hiding in the trees are back for more! Go on, give that axe a twirl!

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Got room for me behind there?

Speaker: Brok
Text: So long as you don’t break nothing.
[Kratos tries the upgrade killing some zombies nearby.]

Speaker: Brok
Text: Y’see?! See what my touch brung? Say your pa can KILL. You gonna learn to do that too?

Speaker: Atreus
Text: I’m not sure…

Speaker: Kratos
Text: This road… it leads to the mountain?

Speaker: Brok
Text: Should put you in the right direction, sure. Wanna see my wares again?
[Kratos and Atreus continue their journey.]

Speaker: Kratos
Text: You left me to fight alone.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: I did.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: People are one thing. Everything else, you fight… until I say stop or we are dead. Understand? Pull your weight or we go home.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: I understand.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Good then.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Oh, wait… we’re back here again.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Come.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: It was nice meeting you, Brok. I’ll be thinking of a name for your beast.

Speaker: Brok
Text: How ’bout I name her “fucking gratitude”? Hey! Fucking Gratitude - come over here! I like it!
[Kratos decides to buy some new equipment one last time.]

Speaker: Brok
Text: Alright, what’dja break? Good to see you sweatin’ the details. Wear it proudly ya sumbitch! Was that all there is…? Hey watch your ’hinds in there! That place can bust you up real good.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Uh…

Speaker: Kratos
Text: This way.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Uh… that looks inviting. Oooh…

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Wait there.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Sure are a lot of draugr around here! Careful! Take that, draugr! Watch out Father! Nista! I’m ready. Fire, incoming! Enemy down! Ready, father. Wow! I’m set.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Atreus, here.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Yes, father. It’s sinking back down!

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Now, boy!

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Coming! Wasn’t sure we were gonna get outta there…

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Trust I will not let us die. This way.
[They come out of the caves and see stunning view of wild mountain nature.]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Wow… Never been this close to the mountain before. Looks so big. I wish Mom was here to see it.
[Kratos wants to hug his son but stops.]

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Come, boy.
[They find a grand door with a bowl of sand nears it.]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: What is it…? Look. There are runes written along the side.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: What does it say?

Speaker: Atreus
Text: “As we are, we two, we three / As I alone can never be.”

Speaker: Kratos
Text: A riddle?

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Hmmm… maybe there’s a clue around here. Seems like maybe those rings should be moving. The rings are turning! Conic back down. I think that part’s right. That’s it! I see runes!

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Boy, what do those runes say?

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Oooh… It says “Family”. That’s not a clue. It’ the answer! What “I alone can never be” - right?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Use your knife and trace the runes into the sand.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Really? Kynslóð. Something happening! It worked! I’m happy we met Brok… but… I’m happier we’re leaving this place…

Speaker: Kratos
Text: It is behind us now. Boy… These tracks…

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Mm… a boar maybe? Not sure. But I’ll find it.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: It is important for a warrior to keep his skills sharp.
[They stumble upon a troll Brenna Dauði (Burning Death)]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Woah!

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Focus up!

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Nista! Fire on your right. I’m ready. I’m set.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Get back, boy.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Need more time. All set. Whoah!
[Kratos and Atreus manages to defeat this monster.]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Phew… I’m outta breath.
[For the victory over the troll, Kratos gets a chest… but its locked.]

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Here. What does it say?

Speaker: Atreus
Text: The runes symbolise three Nornir.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Nornir?

Speaker: Atreus
Text: The fates.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: The fates. No good comes from them.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Okay…
[Kratos rings three bells with runes on them.]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: We can open the chest now!

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Boy… I hear your animal ahead. Shoot when you are ready. Remember… draw to your chest. A wild boar hide is thick.
[Atreus shoots strictly following the instructions of Kratos.]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: But… I hit it. Didn’t I? I did what you said and it looked like it bounced off. Could the boar be magical?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Hunh. What do you think?

Speaker: Atreus
Text: It looked weirder than any boar I’ve ever seen…

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Get after it then. Stay alert.
[They find routed camp.]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: More of those people?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Something else.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Some of the bodies are those weird dead things. There’s Draugr here too. They must have been fighting?
[At the end of the camp Kratos sees giant piece of a column barricaded the path.]

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Here. It run under.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: I got it. Elbow up. Steady hand. Relax… accuracy over speed… YES!
[He hit the boar but it runs away.]

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Do not lose it.
[Rejoicing at luck, Atreus runs after the boar, losing his mother’s knife in haste. Kratos picks it up, grumbles and runs after his son. Everything around is suddenly clouded by fog.]

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Boy! Where are you?

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Hurry father! I found him!

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Atreus!

Speaker: Atreus
Text: He’s slowing down!

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Wait for me, boy!

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Father, over here!

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Atreus?! Where are you?

Speaker: Woman’s Voice
Text: WHAT DID YOU DO!?!

Speaker: Atreus
Text: I’m sorry!

Speaker: Kratos
Text: ATREUS!!
[He starts to run as fast as he can. Getting out on a small clearing, he sees a woman and Atreus. A woman is trying to heal the boar.]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: We didn’t know he belonged to anyone.

Speaker: Woman
Text: He doesn’t. He’s my friend.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: The boy was following my command.

Speaker: Woman
Text: Then help fix this. Hold here lease. HOLD, I said. He’s losing blood. The last of his kind in all the realm and you shoot him. You needed food?

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Target practice…

Speaker: Woman
Text: Target practice…

Speaker: Atreus
Text: I’m so so sorry…

Speaker: Woman
Text: Keep that pressure on. The blame is mine. I should have kept a closer eye.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Will he die?

Speaker: Woman
Text: I will not let him. You - the arrow cut a tideway inside him. Find both ends and hold them tightly. Start with the left side. Grab it and hold. Now the right side. Hold it tight. Good. Now pull them together - line them up. Sunnan- þoka.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: You’re a witch…

Speaker: Witch
Text: I can’t finish the healing here. My home is just beyond the trees there. You’ll carry him? He must not die. Good. He seems stable and aim for now. Greiða! This way.  That bow’s a little big for you. Isn’t it?

Speaker: Atreus
Text: My mother made it for me. Said I’d grow into it.

Speaker: Witch
Text: I’ve never seen you in these woods. She must miss you being away from home.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: She… she’s dead. We’re taking her ashes to the highest peak in the realms.

Speaker: Witch
Text: Ashes?

Speaker: Atreus
Text: It was her last wish.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Boy!

Speaker: Witch
Text: I’m… sorry for your loss. We’re here.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: You live in a tree?

Speaker: Witch
Text: Not in it - below it. Heimili !

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Look!
[Giant turtle digs up with a tree on its back.]

Speaker: Witch
Text: It’s alright.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Is he friendly?!

Speaker: Witch
Text: I promise you he’s safe. He won’t hurt anyone…

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Boy…
[The witch opens the door and Kratos brings the boar inside.]

Speaker: Witch
Text: Quickly. Place him on the stave there. Keep him still.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: You live alone?

Speaker: Witch
Text: It’s better this way.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Yeah, my father doesn’t like people either.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Boy.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Well, you don’t.

Speaker: Witch
Text: Hold him still - before he hurts himself. Good. Easy… rest now… I need two more things. Fresh red root grows just behind the house. Can you pull a cluster?
[Atreus looks at Kratos. He nods. Atreus leave the house.]

Speaker: Kratos
Text: What else?

Speaker: Witch
Text: I… I know you’re a god. Not of this realm, but there’s mistaken it. He doesn’t know, does he? About your true nature - or his own?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: That is none of your concern.

Speaker: Witch
Text: The gods of these realms don’t take kindly to outsiders. Trust me, I know. When they find you - and they will - they’ll make things difficult. The boy will want answers.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: That will be my problem.

Speaker: Witch
Text: Whatever you’re hiding, you cannot protect him forever.

Speaker: Witch
Text: But you’re right… doesn’t concern me. I also need Lamb’s Cress. Do you mind? It’s a white-petalled flower in my garden just a handful.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Lambs Cress…
[He leave the house.]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: I like her. I mean, she lives under a turtle!

Speaker: Kratos
Text: You are too open with her. We do not know if she can be trusted.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: She hasn’t tried to kill us.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Yet.
[Kratos gathers flowers and returns to Atreus. He tries to pull the root out of the ground.]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Can you help? I can’t quite, get it.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Would this help?

Speaker: Atreus
Text: I dropped it…?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: When you were chasing the animal.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: What’s wrong with me? If I’d lost it…

Speaker: Kratos
Text: You did lose it.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: I’ll take better care of it from now on.
[They return to the Witch.]

Speaker: Witch
Text: Ah, exactly what I need.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: So he’s going to live?

Speaker: Witch
Text: Yes.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: When we are leaving.

Speaker: Witch
Text: Wait… Not without thanks.
[A witch dunks her fingers into some kind of salve. Kratos quickly grabs her hand.]

Speaker: Witch
Text: You want solitude? This mark will hide you from those who might make your journey… difficult.
[Looking threateningly at the witch, Kratos lets her smear his neck.]

Speaker: Witch
Text: Leyna .
[She also smears Atreus’ neck.]

Speaker: Witch
Text: Leyna . Heimili ! There a shortcut below the house that leads safely out of these woods. Follow this path down, then head towards daylight.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Will we see you again?

Speaker: Witch
Text: As much or as little as you like. Now get out of here.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Come, boy.

Speaker: Witch
Text: This underground passage should put you back on your path to the mountain. Just use the boat. And take this… You can use it to orient yourself and navigate the world. It will always steer you towards your goals.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: I see a boat. Nightmares! Nista! Above you, look out! I’m ready. Nightmares… Mom used to tell me about them. Didn’t think they were actually real.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Nightmares?

Speaker: Atreus
Text: They give people nightmares. Or they ARE nightmares? I don’t remember which. I wish I could ask her.
[Kratos moves giant block of solid stone.]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Isn’t that heavy? Doesn’t seem heavy…

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Do not touch the water.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Why?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Do you know what is under the surface?

Speaker: Atreus
Text: No, it’s pitch black.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: When do not touch the water. Over there!

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Now we’ll get to that mountain quick. I just can’t believe I’m here, doing all this. There was a time I thought I’d never leave our woods. Or even my own bed sometimes.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: You’ were not to blame for your sickness.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Oh. I know. I guess I’m just saying… this is great. There’s the mountain! Look how close we are.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: We ﬂow into sea water.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: How do you know?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Do you not smell it?

Speaker: Atreus
Text: If that smell is the sea, the sea stinks. Look at that. It’s Thor…

Speaker: Kratos
Text: God of Thunder…

Speaker: Atreus
Text: That’s right! I never thought you listened when mother spoke of the gods.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: I seldom did. Did he speak of one who could feel no pain?

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Oh - that sounds like Baldur.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Baldur…

Speaker: Atreus
Text: An Aesir god. Son of Odin and Frigg.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: And Odin is king…

Speaker: Atreus
Text: That’s right. Why do you ask?
[Kratos says nothing. He continues rowing.]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: I think I see something… just sitting there in the middle of the lake. I see runes there, on his chest. Can’t quite make it out. It reads: “Sacrifice your arms to the centre of the water; awaken again the cradle of the world.” What… throw our weapons into the water? Guess that won’t be a problem for you. Are you gonna do it?
[Kratos stands and throw his axe into the sea.]

Speaker: Kratos
Text: The axe did not return…
[The lake begins to shake like during a storm.]

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Hang on, boy!

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Okay!

Speaker: Kratos
Text: What is this?
[Ancient as stars themselves and huge as mountain serpent appear from the depths.]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: It’s the World Serpent…

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Stay calm, boy!
[The serpent starts talking. Its speech is more like a growl from the depths of hell.]

Speaker: Kratos
Text: It speaks?!

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Yeah! Mom said he’s friendly!

Speaker: Kratos
Text: What is it saying?

Speaker: Atreus
Text: I don’t know! That… that was amazing… Wait… there’s a shipwreck way over there. See that? And there’s the statue of Thor. Except… I can see a lot more of him now.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: The Water dropped - when the serpent rose.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Oooo… that mist be why that beach wasn’t here before. See? And there’s the mountain! Look it - that building leads from the foot of the mountain to that golden temple.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: It was all just tinder the surface.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Except for the statue. Good thing, huh? There’s even dock – there, next to the flag. We’re going to the dock first, right? We’ll be the first people to walk on it in who knows how long!

Speaker: Kratos
Text: You know of that serpent?

Speaker: Atreus
Text: He’s one of the Giants - and he’s so big he’s wrapped around the whole world and bites his own tail.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: An exaggeration.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: I dunno… looked pretty big to me. You want to dock here? Nista! Ready. Yeah, take that! That wasn’t so bad. It some kind of drawing… maybe a map? Ooooh maybe a TREASURE map! Hey, that could be valuable… How long you think this has been here?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: A very long time…

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Is this the way the mountain?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: It would seem.

Speaker: Brok
Text: If it isn't the bearded beefer and his sac-seed! Have I got something for you two…

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Brok? But how did you -

Speaker: Brok
Text: None of yer fuckin’ business. Now get in here. I got something for ya! And don’t go makin’ pigeyes at my spot… I saw it first!

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Okay…  What do you think he wants?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: To test our patience.

Speaker: Brok
Text: When word gets out about my new shop, folks’ll finally come outta hiding. They’ll be clawing all over each other just to catch a whiff of my wares - you watch!

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Wait - aren’t we talking to Brok?

Speaker: Brok
Text: You rush around like that everywhere? Yeesh. Catch!
[He throws Kratos some blue glowing rock.]

Speaker: Brok
Text: The pile of ﬂocks there - with that Key of Yggdrasil, you can open a magic door to the branches of the World Tree - a shortcut ’tween the realms. If y’ever see ’em out in the world, use it to get back to me quick. But it’s only one-way - straight back here and nowhere else. Whatever you do, never, never, EVER, never, ever, ever, ever, ever throw yourself over the edge of the path… lest you want death.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Yeah. I don’t see us wanting that.
[Kratos decides to buy some upgrades.]

Speaker: Brok
Text: What’s it gonna be this time? What can I gotcha, you little fart? Got somethin’ else in mind? You got a fine deal there. That oughta keep ’em from hackin’ bits off ya. Was that all there is…? Come on in, then. So much for peace & quiet… Wear it proudly, ya sumbitch. You hittin’ the road or chewin’ the fat!

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Atreus, to me.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: I’m coming. I’m coming.
[They go up some platform…]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: What is this?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: A horn. Here is the end.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Can we blow into it?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Without knowing the outcome?

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Well. We usually push every button and pull every lever we see!

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Outcomes we can predict. No, this is something else. We must develop your instincts.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Here we go. Nista! Watch it! Tell me when… Behind you, look out! Watch your back!

Speaker: Kratos
Text: With luck, that tower leads through to the mountain.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: I’m ready. Hm. I don’t know these runes. If we find a cipher, I bet I could figure it out. What was that?! I’m ready. Nista! This one, father! At the ready.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Another one here.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Look. It’s the World Serpent. He’s so much bigger than I imagined. Oh, look, he bit Thor! Or… will bite him, looks like…
[A pool of poison blocks their way.]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: What is that? Smells awful…

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Poison…

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Whoah, it’s a Tatzelwurm! Watch out! I’m ready. Hey… it’s a fragment of a language cipher. We should look for more like this. What were those things? They smelled awful.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Your mother called them “scorn poles.” Poison magic. She was the one who showed me how to disable them.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: (chuckles]

Speaker: Kratos
Text: What?

Speaker: Atreus
Text: It’s just funny to think of her teaching you something.

Chapter: The Other Half Of The Brand
Text: [They leave the caves.]

Chapter: The Other Half Of The Brand
Speaker: Atreus
Text: Whoa… Sure is foggy here. Another dwarf. Should we -

Chapter: The Other Half Of The Brand
Speaker: Kratos
Text: No. He is of no consequence.

Chapter: The Other Half Of The Brand
Speaker: Dwarf
Text: Excuse me, but… how did you come by that axe?

Chapter: The Other Half Of The Brand
Speaker: Kratos
Text: That is my concern alone.

Chapter: The Other Half Of The Brand
Speaker: Dwarf
Text: And while I won’t dispute that… I know that blade. It was one of ours. But we didn’t make it for you.

Chapter: The Other Half Of The Brand
Speaker: Kratos
Text: Step aside.

Chapter: The Other Half Of The Brand
Speaker: Dwarf
Text: I can’t. See, the woman we made it for… I was, well, I’am… quite fond of her. And I would be somewhat… displeased if it turns out that… you did something to her.

Chapter: The Other Half Of The Brand
Speaker: Atreus
Text: It was my mother’s. She left it to father before she died.

Chapter: The Other Half Of The Brand
Speaker: Dwarf
Text: Faye’s dead? I’m… very, very sorry to hear that. She was a fierce warrior… and a good woman. Okay… I will make improvements to the axe.

Chapter: The Other Half Of The Brand
Speaker: Atreus
Text: But… nobody asked you to…

Chapter: The Other Half Of The Brand
Speaker: Dwarf
Text: Well, it’s true but… But knowing your mother, she would have insisted I repair that act of vandalism perpetrated against her axe by my brother.

Chapter: The Other Half Of The Brand
Speaker: Atreus
Text: I knew it! You are Brok’s brother. The other half of the brand’s here…

Chapter: The Other Half Of The Brand
Speaker: Kratos
Text: The blue one is your brother?

Chapter: The Other Half Of The Brand
Speaker: Dwarf
Text: Yes, though my talents are vastly superior. No boast - swear to Faye.

Chapter: The Other Half Of The Brand
Text: [Kratos threatenly pulls out his axe.]

Chapter: The Other Half Of The Brand
Speaker: Kratos
Text: Do not undo his work. Improve upon it only.

Chapter: The Other Half Of The Brand
Speaker: Dwarf
Text: Yeeeah… but can you put it down over there?

Chapter: The Other Half Of The Brand
Speaker: Kratos
Text: No.

Chapter: The Other Half Of The Brand
Speaker: Dwarf
Text: That handle is filthy… Okay then… I’ll just… I will just… Ugh… is that dried blood?

Chapter: The Other Half Of The Brand
Speaker: Atreus
Text: So what were you working on?

Chapter: The Other Half Of The Brand
Speaker: Dwarf
Text: Oh, that… I call it the “Sky Mover.” Just up that mountain waits a treasure trove “rare resource.” Once I mine it, I’ll need a way to bring it all down…

Chapter: The Other Half Of The Brand
Speaker: Atreus
Text: And you know how to fix it?

Chapter: The Other Half Of The Brand
Speaker: Dwarf
Text: Not even a little.

Chapter: The Other Half Of The Brand
Text: [Kratos buys some upgrades and they leave Sindri’s shop.]

Chapter: The Other Half Of The Brand
Speaker: Atreus
Text: You think all dwarves are as weird as Brok and Sindri?

Chapter: The Other Half Of The Brand
Speaker: Kratos
Text: No.

Chapter: The Other Half Of The Brand
Speaker: Atreus
Text: Wonder why they don’t get along anymore. I mean, they’re family…

Chapter: The Other Half Of The Brand
Speaker: Kratos
Text: That this is there matter alone, boy.

Chapter: The Other Half Of The Brand
Text: [Kratos start climbing.]

Chapter: The Other Half Of The Brand
Speaker: Atreus
Text: I can’t tell… Are we getting closer to the mountain?

Chapter: The Other Half Of The Brand
Speaker: Kratos
Text: We are.

Chapter: The Other Half Of The Brand
Text: [They encounter Poison Revenant.]

Chapter: The Other Half Of The Brand
Speaker: Atreus
Text: Woah!

Chapter: The Other Half Of The Brand
Speaker: Kratos
Text: There.

Chapter: The Other Half Of The Brand
Speaker: Atreus
Text: She really didn’t want anyone to open that, huh? But why let a deadly curse stop you? These Revenants don’t quit! Father, you’re REALLY hurt! Hold on! You’ll be okay. Father, watch out! Nista! Tell me when… You’re not looking good! Poison! Nista! Father! Woah! Another Revenant! Nista! Watch out Father!

Chapter: The Other Half Of The Brand
Speaker: Kratos
Text: Take her down, boy!

Chapter: The Other Half Of The Brand
Speaker: Atreus
Text: Can’t yet. I’m set. Nista! You don’t look too good Father, watch out! Look out Father! Nista! I’m ready.

Chapter: The Other Half Of The Brand
Speaker: Kratos
Text: Your arrows!

Chapter: The Other Half Of The Brand
Speaker: Atreus
Text: Watch out! One left! Nista! All set. You don’t look too good. Ready. I can get her, just say the word! Watch the poison! Nista! I can’t yet. Careful! This is locked up good. Do you think for this last leg up the mountain that maybe I can carry her?

Chapter: The Other Half Of The Brand
Speaker: Kratos
Text: I told you, no.

Chapter: The Other Half Of The Brand
Speaker: Atreus
Text: Why? She meant more to me than you anyway.

Chapter: The Other Half Of The Brand
Speaker: Kratos
Text: What?

Chapter: The Other Half Of The Brand
Speaker: Atreus
Text: I just meant… I spent more time with her You were off hunting a lot.

Chapter: The Other Half Of The Brand
Speaker: Kratos
Text: It would serve you to stop talking.

Chapter: The Other Half Of The Brand
Speaker: Atreus
Text: These wolves look kinda sick. Eww! Eat dirt! Watch out Father! Yeah, take that! Nista! Glad that’s over.

Chapter: The Other Half Of The Brand
Text: [Suddenly a giant troll attacks our heroes. The troll tells something to Kratos, but no one understands it.]

Chapter: The Other Half Of The Brand
Speaker: Atreus
Text: Let him GO!

Chapter: The Other Half Of The Brand
Speaker: Kratos
Text: AAAAARRGH!!

Chapter: The Other Half Of The Brand
Speaker: Atreus
Text: Father…

Chapter: The Other Half Of The Brand
Speaker: Kratos
Text: Ready yourself.

Chapter: The Other Half Of The Brand
Speaker: Atreus
Text: Watch ‘em! Watch your back. Back off! Found a healing stone! You okay? Behind you, watch out! Do it now! Look out behind you! That one’s down! Father, no! Watch ’em! Behind you! Right flank! Look out behind you! Look out behind you! Behind you, watch out! Father, get up! Careful! From behind! Behind you, look out! On your left! Take this! Look out! On your left! Father, you’re hurt! Watch out Father! Behind you! You gonna be okay? Watch out! Watch your back! Enemy down! Watch ’em! Look out Father! At the ready. Watch out! Need a healing stone? Watch ‘em! An Ogre?! Here? Who built this place? Whoa… I can see why Mom wanted us to bring her here.

Chapter: The Other Half Of The Brand
Speaker: Kratos
Text: Indeed.

Chapter: The Other Half Of The Brand
Speaker: Atreus
Text: Wonder if Sindri knows his “Sky Mover” is tangled with roots up here?

Chapter: The Other Half Of The Brand
Speaker: Kratos
Text: I doubt it.

Chapter: The Other Half Of The Brand
Speaker: Atreus
Text: So how’s he going to get it to work?

Chapter: The Other Half Of The Brand
Speaker: Kratos
Text: I do not care.
[They go further and notice the dense black smoke on the bridge leading to the top of the mountain.]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Is that… smoke?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Stay back, boy. We must find another way up.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: The witch. Wish she was here. I bet she could get us past this.

Speaker: Witch
Text: My magic is useless against the Black Breath, and there’s no way around it. Odin saw to that long ago.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: What are you doing here?

Speaker: Witch
Text: Making sure you can finish your journey.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Why wait to warn us?

Speaker: Witch
Text: I was busy saving my friend, if you remember..

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Mm.

Speaker: Witch
Text: The Black Breath is a corruption of magic even I can’t dispel. Only the pure Light of Alfheim is strong enough to break through it. But that road ts long. What does the goal mean to you?

Speaker: Atreus
Text: It’s everything.

Speaker: Witch
Text: Follow me.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Why help us?

Speaker: Witch
Text: Maybe I see more of myself in you than I’m willing to admit. Maybe… maybe by helping you, I’ll make up for a lifetime of mistakes. Or maybe I just like you.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Even though we shot your friend?

Speaker: Witch
Text: Even though you shot my friend, yes.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Where must we go?

Speaker: Witch
Text: To a realm beyond your own…
[THE PATH TO THE MOUNTAIN COMPLETED.]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: We’re going to another realm?! Are you coming with us?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Only for a little while.

Speaker: Witch
Text: Only for a little while. We’ll use this. Greiða!

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Can’t. Sindri said it was broken.

Speaker: Witch
Text: Sindri?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: The dwarf at the foot of these hills.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: He was fixing it when we got here.

Speaker: Witch
Text: No one was there when I passed by. Perhaps he finished? Dwarves are awfully resourceful.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: And irritating, based on the two we have met.

Speaker: Witch
Text: That too. Just give that a turn. There. See? Týr’s Temple is at the centre of the lake. It is from there we travel to Alfheim. Thankfully, it’s no longer under water.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Why is that creature in the bay?

Speaker: Witch
Text: No one knows. He just appeared one day. Soon after, Thor attacked and their battle could be felt across all the realms. Ultimately, it ended in a stalemate and Thor returned to Odin empty-handed. The Serpent stayed and grew so large he now spans all of Midgard.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: See! Told you…

Speaker: Witch
Text: They’ve hated each other ever since… destined to kill each other come Ragnarok.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: You believe in Ragnarok?

Speaker: Witch
Text: I dearly wish I didn’t, child.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: You know… we actually talked to the World Serpent.

Speaker: Witch
Text: You did?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: An exaggeration.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: I’m good with languages… even ones I’ve never heard before. But when he talks, I can’t understand any of it!

Speaker: Witch
Text: Sadly no one can. He speaks a dead tongue.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Oh. Must be lonely.

Speaker: Witch
Text: Watch your step. Just along here.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: You sure? We came through here before and there’s no way back across. See?

Speaker: Witch
Text: Is that so? Let me show you something. Are you watching? Ljósta!

Speaker: Atreus
Text: What? It’s solid!

Speaker: Witch
Text: Elven architecture. My bowstring was soaked in the Light of Alfheim. It can now reawaken the magic of the Elves.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Wait… it won’t just disappear, will it?

Speaker: Witch
Text: Not as long as the light shines free. This way.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: I want one. Those roots— what kind of magic is that?

Speaker: Witch
Text: It’s Vanir.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: From Vanaheim?

Speaker: Witch
Text: You know of it?

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Just stories. Mother didn’t say much about the Vanir gods, just that they’re always at war with the Aesir. Guess compared to Odin & Thor, they’re the good guys.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: There are no “good” gods, boy. Thought I taught you that.

Speaker: Witch
Text: Those runes are of Muspelheim, the fire realm No place for children, even brave ones. The tongue of Niflheim. A foul place of ice and mists… and Dwarven mischief. Týr’s Temple. Built with help from the Giants, Great Týr used it to travel the nine realms and keep the peace between them.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Doesn’t seem very peaceful. Everywhere we go, we’re attacked. Especially by dead things.

Speaker: Witch
Text: The risen dead grow ever more numerous. Once, the roads and trails would have been full of people. Now, all have hid or fled save for the reavers savage enough to survive in such a world. Make a right at the bottom of these stairs.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Another one of those light crystals.

Speaker: Witch
Text: Wait there while I reawaken the light. Ljósta!

Speaker: Atreus
Text: That did it. What are we doing exactly?

Speaker: Witch
Text: Mending the disrepair. Start by lifting that axle. Good! Now push it back into place. Now realign the wheel onto the track. Perfect! Now push the bridge along the track.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Whuh-? The whole entire bridge is turning! How ts the whole entire bridge turning? Boy. You’re really strong.

Speaker: Witch
Text: Just keep pushing until the bridge reaches its first position. Tired yet?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: NO.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: He’s always been really strong! So about the dead… we heard someone call them “Hel-Walkers”. But what are they?

Speaker: Witch
Text: They are poor, restless souls, denied their judgment and their peace.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: By what? Could Vanir magic raise the dead?

Speaker: Witch
Text: It could, once, but this is no spell. This plague of dead is but a symptom of a world out of balance. Something, or someone, has meddled with powerful forces. That its all I know for sure. That’s perfect! Come back up! We’re ready now!

Speaker: Atreus
Text: That was impressive. You didn’t hurt your back, did you?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: I did not hurt my back.

Speaker: Witch
Text: Through these doors.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Wait. So did the Giants or the Elves build Týr’s temple?

Speaker: Witch
Text: All the races helped with its construction. It was the last great act of cooperation between the real before peace disappeared for good.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Ah, more of those. Good.

Speaker: Witch
Text: Ljósta!

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Your bowstring stopped glowing.

Speaker: Witch
Text: Its power is now depleted. Only a few nocks of magic remained in the bowstring, and we used them Your bow please. Once you claim the Light of Alfheim, infuse the bowstring with its power. Don’t forget!

Speaker: Atreus
Text: You talk like you’re not coming with us.

Speaker: Witch
Text: I’ll try but measures were taken to keep me trapped in Midgard.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Why?

Speaker: Witch
Text: The gods don’t care for me much.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Is this it?

Speaker: Witch
Text: This temple has been asleep, underwater, for almost a hundred and fifty winters. It needs only the light of the Bifröst to reawaken.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Those roots don’t look like your magic.

Speaker: Witch
Text: They aren’t. These roots are part of the great World Tree, and make travel between the realms possible. Approach the table.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: How does it work?

Speaker: Witch
Text: You will need this — a Bifröst — to create travel between realms. It can capture, hold, and transfer the Light of Alfheim. Place the Bifröst there.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: What now?

Speaker: Witch
Text: Give it a moment. The temple needs time to wake up from its long slumber. It is from this room and this room alone— that you will be able to cross between realms. What you see before you represents the temple in which we stand, as well as the realm towers that encircle the Lake of Nine outside. All the realms exist in the same physical space, reflections of each other. These doors, the towers outside, and the nine realms are all intertwined and co-existing on the branches of the World Tree— separated only by the Bifröst light of Alfheim. This place can focus and control that light.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: And is this the World Tree?

Speaker: Witch
Text: Only an artistic representation of it. No, the Yggdrasill is much, much more than this. The Tree of Life is bound to the fate of the world, just as we are bound to it. The tree nourishes our soils. The dew from its leaves feeds our valleys and rivers. The tree’s very existence supports all of creation along its boughs its life energy interwoven into the tapestry of life… birth, growth, death, and rebirth… every strand, transcending time, transcending space. Everything comes back to the tree. So… that’s how it works. But I’m guessing you were looking for a more practical answer.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Yes.

Speaker: Witch
Text: Very well… The bridge you pushed outside is currently positioned to lead to the realm of Vanaheim. Instead, turn the wheel to our actual destination—Alfheim.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Wait, is this moving the big bridge outside?

Speaker: Witch
Text: Yes. The wheel turns the bridge, and the bridge aligns to the different realm towers on the lake out

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Wait… there’s no tower on this one.

Speaker: Witch
Text: And that’s why realm travel to Jötunheim is impossible. Without a tower for the bridge to lock into, the sequence can’t begin. Every realm has a travel rune that unlocks the bridge to that realm. I’m giving you the one for Alfheim. Now you can lock in your destination. We’re ready. Remember to take the Bifröst you don’t want to lose that. Now the realm travel bridge will align, and the realm between realms will open. See that giant crystal? Each realm has a corresponding one that focuses and amplifies the power of the Bifröst, opening the bridge to that realm. That’s why realm travel is only possible from this room.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: What about that one realm tower missing from the lake?

Speaker: Witch
Text: The Jötunheim tower disappeared from all realms over a hundred winters ago, when the Giants vanished from Midgard. Where the tower went and how they moved it remain a mystery.
[A REALM BEYOND COMPLETED.]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: It didn’t work. We’re still here.

Speaker: Witch
Text: Follow me.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: The Bifröst is dark.

Speaker: Witch
Text: This trip was its last use. There’s no going back until it’s replenished with the Light of Alfheim.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: So we are trapped.

Speaker: Witch
Text: Someone of your ability should have little trouble getting back to Midgard.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: And we’ll be able to make that Black Breath go away?

Speaker: Witch
Text: With the captured Light of Alfheim, yes. Welcome to Alfheim, gentlemen. Think you can… spot… The light. I can barely see it. Something’s wrong. See that column of light on the horizon? It’s housed in the heart of a ringed temple. We’ll find what we need there. No, no, no, no, no. Dammit, not yet…
[She’s sucked back to Midgard.]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: What’s happening—?!

Speaker: Witch
Text: To restore the Bifröst’s magic, you must step into The Light. But be very careful not to get caught up by it.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: No!

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Hm.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: She’s not dead, is she?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Not likely. Come.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Look at this place…

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Stay by me. Touch nothing.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Okay what. That stuffs strong… Is there something glowing inside that knot?  I think you killed it. Whoa… What’s that about?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Not our concern, boy. Focus. Boy. What does it say?

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Hm… something about an “eternal war for the light.” I don’t get it - if both sides need it, why not just share it.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Greed. You will find it a common cause for war.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: They keep murdering the Light Elves.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: It is war… the end of one. The robed ones lost.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Oh. Watch your back! Behind you, enemy fire! I’m set. At the ready. What are they attacking us for? We didn’t do anything.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Hmph. More will come.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Ugh… Where’s this stuff even come from? Yeah! Did you say something?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: No.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Oh. Okay. At least we’re getting closer to the light. Another cipher piece! I’ll see what I can fit together. Wait… is that Sindri?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: How are you here before us, dwarf? We were told our path was the only one between realms.

Speaker: Sindri
Text: It may be the only way for you to travel. But we dwarves are full of surprises.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: That is not an answer.

Speaker: Sindri
Text: Ah, hang onto that sense of wonder! There’s so little mystery once you’ve amassed the wealth of arcane knowledge that I have. Where to comb the realms for exotic resources, how to craft them into creations that defy imagination… to the novice I’m sure it all seems like magic. Oh, alright, it’s magic are you happy now?
[Kratos buys some upgrades.]

Speaker: Sindri
Text: What speaks to you? You probably shouldn’t let my brother lay hands on it again, but if he does. tell him to temper his steel longer he’s warping the bit-work. Anything you need, young sir… aaand we’re back to you. What a surprise. I don’t suppose you could try keeping that clean… Wear it in good health. Pssst… how about you, young one? If you’re not in a hurry…

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Look, there’s a boat tangled up over there. Boat’s free!
[Kratos pushes the boat to the water.]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: What’d you say?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: I said nothing.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Okay…
[They board the boat and sail away.]

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Did your mother speak of this realm?

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Not much. Just that since the Elves were always fighting over the Light, it kept them isolated. Huh?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Again, I said nothing.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Weird. Could have sworn you said some—AARGH!

Speaker: Kratos
Text: What is it, boy?

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Voices. You don’t hear that?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: I hear nothing.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: It’s going away now. Lots of voices… Angry. You really didn’t hear that?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: No.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: It felt… evil. Look. Should we try talking to them?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: No.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: But maybe they need help.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: They do not stop us, so they do not concern us.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: But maybe—

Speaker: Kratos
Text: They do not concern us.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Look at that… that must be the ringed temple. It’s sad the Elves can’t work things out. Alfheim’s such a beautiful place, but…

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Enough.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Look, they have sand bowls in Alfheim too!

Speaker: Kratos
Text: What does it ask?

Speaker: Atreus
Text: “Without me or within me death is sure / Yet within you I am life most pure.” But… I don’t see any runes around here.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: We must find it. Back to the boat.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: It’s sad the Elves can’t work things out. Alfheim’s such a beautiful place, but… war makes it ugly.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: You see with the eyes of a child. In war, a soldier sees beauty only in the blood of his enemy. The rest of him is lost - sometimes never to return.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: You… know about war, don’t you…

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Wars are fought for two things… survival, or advantage. Battles may be won by the better soldier. Wars are won by those who are willing to sacrifice everything to ensure victory.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: The blue door - that’s going to be at the entrance. Let’s go!

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Atreus, follow me.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Be right there! Above you, watch out! Ready. Watch out! Yeah! Watch out Father! Tell me when… Got ’em! Behind you! I’m set. I don’t think so! Watch ’em! It’s locked magically… Sindri said… mother was a warrior. Was she in a war too?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Of a sort. Her family was decimated by hostile rivals, and she alone survived. She walked the warrior’s path, but her war was to live on. To brave an unforgiving world alone.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: And that’s why she asked Sindri and Brok to make her the Axe?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: She had the strength to wield such a weapon, and the wisdom to use it for good. She found purpose in protecting the weak.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: So…

Speaker: Kratos
Text: No.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: The blue door that’s gotta be the entrance. Let’s go!

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Careful, boy.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: What are they doing? The bridge is gone. They covered the crystal with that stuff. Why?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: To prevent reinforcements.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Nista! On your right, incoming fire! At the ready. Look out! Behind you! All set. Nista!

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Well done.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Need more time. I’m ready. Look out behind you! You look hurt! Coming! They got lucky. Only one more! Maybe we can fix the bridge from down there? Okay so that did something… I think? No! Get up! Okay so that did something… I think? Fire, incoming! From behind! Got ’em! Behind you, watch out!

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Okay so that did something… I think? Look out Father! Right on target! Careful! Got ‘em! Nista! What is their problem with us?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: We do not belong here.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Wait. Combined together like that… they kind of look like a rune. But it doesn’t make sense…

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Come. Back to the sand bowl.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Father! The pillars and ring form an elvish rune!

Speaker: Kratos
Text: What does it ask?

Speaker: Atreus
Text: “Without me or within me death is sure / Yet within you I am life most pure.” Yep—it’s “water” all right. Aaah!

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Boy?

Speaker: Atreus
Text: It was the voices again… but different voices. Less angry. They were asking for help.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: We are here for the Light I do not care who they are nor what they want.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: You never care about anything…

Speaker: Kratos
Text: You have something to say?

Speaker: Atreus
Text: No… Logr. What’s happening? Woahhh… look what we found! Father…

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Yes?

Speaker: Atreus
Text: The voices I heard, I… it was hard to make out… but way in the back I’m pretty sure I heard… mother.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: That is not possible.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: But I know what I heard-

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Atreus. Enough.
[Kratos and Atreus encounter new enemy - flying Dark Elf with spear.]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: He looks different. Look at those horns.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Behind me, boy.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: That can’t be good. Watch ’em! Father! I’m set. Fire, incoming! Right flank! On your left! You need to find a healing stone! Father, get up! Fire, incoming! I’ll knock him down! Yea! Yea!

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Stay away from those cages.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Wonder why they’re locked up.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Be ready.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: What? Nista! Tell me when… Hope that was worth it. Can we keep moving? I think this is something.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Atreus, to me.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Father, over here. Phew… I’m ready… I’m ready… Fire, incoming! Careful! Watch out! Enemy down! Nista! Stay down! I’m ready. You gonna be okay? Think that side hallway will get us to the temple?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: We will find out.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: You were wrong back there.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Oh…?

Speaker: Atreus
Text: I know mother’s voice better than anyone. It was her.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: She is gone, boy. Speak no more of this.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Fine.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Atreus, follow me.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Sorry I got distracted.
[When heroes going a little further the Dark Elf flies up and grabs Atreus.]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: No!

Speaker: Kratos
Text: BOY!

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Father!

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Get off him!

Speaker: Kratos
Text: RAAAAAA!!
[Two Elves are trying to hold Kratos down. He explodes with Spartan rage and break their bones using his bare hands. After that he begins to crush the wall, trying to get to Atreus.]

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Hold on, boy! Fight!

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Get away from me!

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Run, boy!
[Seeing that he cannot cope with such a monster, the Dark Elf flies away. Kratos crushes several more enemies and saves Atreus.]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Thanks.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Mm.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: No way across here. Too bad the witch’s bowstring doesn’t work anymore.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Hey, you sure the witch is okay? I’d hate to think she died helping us.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: She knew what she was doing.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Okay. Ugh! More of it.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: If we cut enough away, the bridge above us should re-appear.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Riiight.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Expect resistance.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Right. Nista! I’m set. Tell me when… It’s one of the Ancients! How do you kill something made of rock?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: You find its weak point.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: There. His weak spot’s open! Fire, incoming! Whoah, I can’t believe that worked! Dark Elf, watch him! Nista! Finally… I see something up there. You’re freezing it first! Smart! That did it! We brought the main bridge back!

Speaker: Kratos
Text: We must find a way up.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Huh… guess the light makes more than bridges. Maybe this will spit us out on top. Look! The blue door! We made it.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: The door. There is no seam. We have a problem. These doors do not open.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Hello? I don’t get it. Why even have a door then? Hellooo?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Come. We will find another way in. More of those bells.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: A Nornir chest must be nearby. Alright!

Speaker: Kratos
Text: That dwarf again.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Sindri? Hey Sindri, we found something interesting.

Speaker: Sindri
Text: Oh really? I love something interesting. WHOA - you killed an Ancient?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Yes.

Speaker: Sindri
Text: Was it… difficult?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Yes.

Speaker: Sindri
Text: Is that… all you’re going to give me?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Yes.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Do you really make that axe for my mother?

Speaker: Sindri
Text: Oh, I’d recognize it anywhere. Ask me, one of our best. Infused with the echoing screams of twenty frost trolls. Give or take.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: But why her? How did you know her?

Speaker: Sindri
Text: She sought us out, in the beginning. She was… a special woman. She wanted to protect people. I suppose we thought it was a chance to give power to someone who’d use it for good. She even spoke our native tongue. She’d say, “Madurinn seem gengur eigin vegum hans…” (A madman walks his own path…]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: …gengur einn. (…alone.]

Speaker: Sindri
Text: That’s right! That’s impressive. I see a lot of her in your eyes, you know.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Thanks, Sind-

Speaker: Sindri
Text: Don’t touch me!

Speaker: Atreus
Text: What? I didn’t! I won’t. I’ll come back later…
[Kratos buys some upgrades from Sindri.]

Speaker: Sindri
Text: Where shall we begin? And what do you have your eye on? Ah, what shall it be? Well that’s something. Master Atreus! How may I serve? So, that brings you around, friends? Um, I don’t suppose you could try keeping that clean… What, no? No, just a, it was a question. I’m fine, I’m fine… The secret to any craft is in the fine details… A fine piece of work, I say so myself. Until we meet again, my friends.
[Not far from Sindri’s forge, they find another drawing board.]

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Look here. Another.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Hm… These Giants’s a sorceress. Her name is “Gróa"… Looks like she has visions. Did Odin kill her for her book?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: This way.
[Kratos finds a hole in the wall. They crawl inside the building.]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Whoa! Now that’s impressive. We’re inside.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: There. The light.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: They’ve covered it up with that stuff… why would they do that? Look… another Light Elf. What’s he doing? Oh no! Why are they killing him? He didn’t do anything.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Do not assume. You are seeing the end of a war, boy. You do not know what led to this moment.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: But he didn’t even defend himself.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: It was his choice. We make ours.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: What now?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: The light is near. Look for a way inside.
[Kratos kills a few enemies and slices up some kind of muscle.]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: That did it! Look - more light bridges!

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Follow me.
[Another “muscle” is choped down.]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: You are restoring all the pathways… I don’t think we’re supposed to be in here.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Quiet.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Did you hear that?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Stay alert and by my side.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Hey… when we make it to the light, How do you think we get it in the Bifröst?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: The witch said to step into it.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: She did?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: When she was ripped away from this realm.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Oh. How’d I miss that?

Speaker: Kratos
Text: You were more concerned with her safety than our goal.
[Someone attacks Kratos from behind.]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Father!

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Quiet! I have him. Your knife boy!
Action: (shutting the mouth of the attacking enemy)

Text: [Atreus stabs his knife in the enemy’s head.]

Speaker: Atreus
Text: That was close.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Do not stray from me, boy.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: You don’t gonna tell me. Ecch. It’s so… sticky. Another one!

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Stay back!

Speaker: Atreus
Text: The light…

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Shhh… Yes - we are near our goal. But we must be careful. Understand?

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Got it.

Speaker: Kratos
Text: There. When it falls, be ready. We will need to move quickly.

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Okay.
[He cut down the “muscle”.]

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Jump, boy!

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Right! Look out!

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Here they come! Stay behind me and protect our flank!

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Yes, sir! Nista! That one’s down! There’s so many!

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Keep shooting, boy! I will clear out path!

Speaker: Atreus
Text: Okay. Ready and waiting. Nista!

Speaker: Kratos
Text: Shorten the time between your volleys!

Speaker: Atreus
Text: What happened to “accuracy over speed?!"

Speaker: Kratos
